speech.line: You are light into my hands, where you are like to live.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: The more my fault
To scape his hands where I was like to die.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Ay, and you shall live in pleasure.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: No.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Yes indeed shall you, and taste gentlemen of all fashions. You shall fare well, you shall have the difference of all complexions. What do you stop your ears?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Are you a woman?

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: What would you have me be, and I be not a woman?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: An honest woman, or not a woman.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Marry, whip the gosling, I think I shall have something to do with you. Come, you’re a young foolish sapling, and must be bow’d as I would have you.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: The gods defend me!

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: If it please the gods to defend you by men, then men must comfort you, men must feed you, men stir you up. Boult’s return’d.
Now, sir, hast thou cried her through the market?

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: I have cried her almost to the number of her hairs, I have drawn her picture with my voice.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: And I prithee tell me, how dost thou find the inclination of the people, especially of the younger sort?

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Faith, they listen’d to me as they would have hearken’d to their father’s testament. There was a Spaniard’s mouth wat’red, and he went to bed to her very description.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: We shall have him here tomorrow with his best ruff on.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Tonight, tonight. But, mistress, do you know the French knight that cow’rs i’ the hams?

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Who, Monsieur Verollus?

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Ay, he, he offer’d to cut a caper at the proclamation, but he made a groan at it, and swore he would see her tomorrow.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Well, well, as for him, he brought his disease hither; here he does but repair it. I know he will come in our shadow, to scatter his crowns in the sun.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Well, if we had of every nation a traveller, we should lodge them with this sign.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Pray you come hither a while. You have fortunes coming upon you. Mark me: you must seem to do that fearfully which you commit willingly, despise profit where you have most gain. To weep that you live as ye do makes pity in your lovers; seldom but that pity begets you a good opinion, and that opinion a mere profit.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: I understand you not.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: O, take her home, mistress, take her home. These blushes of hers must be quench’d with some present practice.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Thou sayest true, i’ faith, so they must: for your bride goes to that with shame which is her way to go with warrant.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Faith, some do, and some do not. But, mistress, if I have bargain’d for the joint—

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Thou mayst cut a morsel off the spit.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: I may so.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Who should deny it? Come, young one, I like the manner of your garments well.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Ay, by my faith, they shall not be chang’d yet.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Boult, spend thou that in the town. Report what a sojoumer we have; you’ll lose nothing by custom. When nature fram’d this piece, she meant thee a good turn; therefore say what a paragon she is, and thou hast the harvest out of thine own report.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: I warrant you, mistress, thunder shall not so awake the beds of eels as my giving out her beauty stirs up the lewdly inclin’d. I’ll bring home some tonight.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Come your ways, follow me.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: If fires be hot, knives sharp, or waters deep,
Untied I still my virgin knot will keep.
Diana aid my purpose!

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: What have we to do with Diana? Pray you, will you go with us?

scene.scenelocation: Tarsus. A room in Cleon’s house.

speech.speaker: DION.
speech.line: Why are you foolish? Can it be undone?

speech.speaker: CLE.
speech.line: O Dionyza, such a piece of slaughter
The sun and moon ne’er look’d upon!

speech.speaker: DION.
speech.line: I think you’ll turn a child again.

speech.speaker: CLE.
speech.line: Were I chief lord of all this spacious world,
I’d give it to undo the deed. O lady,
Much less in blood than virtue, yet a princess
To equal any single crown a’ th’ earth
I’ th’ justice of compare! O villain Leonine!
Whom thou hast pois’ned too.
If thou hadst drunk to him, ’t ’ad been a kindness
Becoming well thy fact. What canst thou say
When noble Pericles shall demand his child?

speech.speaker: DION.
speech.line: That she is dead. Nurses are not the fates,
To foster it, not ever to preserve.
She died at night; I’ll say so. Who can cross it?
Unless you play the pious innocent,
And for an honest attribute cry out,
“She died by foul play.”

speech.speaker: CLE.
speech.line: O, go to. Well, well,
Of all the faults beneath the heavens, the gods
Do like this worst.

speech.speaker: DION.
speech.line: Be one of those that thinks
The petty wrens of Tharsus will fly hence
And open this to Pericles. I do shame
To think of what a noble strain you are,
And of how coward a spirit.

speech.speaker: CLE.
speech.line: To such proceeding
Who ever but his approbation added,
Though not his prime consent, he did not flow
From honorable courses.

speech.speaker: DION.
speech.line: Be it so then,
Yet none does know but you how she came dead,
Nor none can know, Leonine being gone.
She did distain my child, and stood between
Her and her fortunes. None would look on her,
But cast their gazes on Marina’s face;
Whilest ours was blurted at and held a mawkin
Not worth the time of day. It pierc’d me thorough,
And though you call my course unnatural,
You not your child well loving, yet I find
It greets me as an enterprise of kindness
Perform’d to your sole daughter.

speech.speaker: CLE.
speech.line: Heavens forgive it!

speech.speaker: DION.
speech.line: And as for Pericles,
What should he say? We wept after her hearse,
And yet we mourn. Her monument
Is almost finished, and her epitaphs
In glitt’ring golden characters express
A general praise to her, and care in us
At whose expense ’tis done.

speech.speaker: CLE.
speech.line: Thou art like the harpy,
Which to betray, dost with thine angel’s face
Seize with thine eagle’s talents.

speech.speaker: DION.
speech.line: Y’ are like one that superstitiously
Do swear to th’ gods that winter kills the flies,
But yet I know you’ll do as I advise.

scene.scenelocation: Tarsus. Before the tomb of Marina.

stagedir.dir: Enter Gower before the monument of Marina at Tharsus.

speech.speaker: GOW.
speech.line: Thus time we waste, and long leagues make short;
Sail seas in cockles, have and wish but for’t,
Making, to take our imagination,
From bourn to bourn, region to region.
By you being pardoned, we commit no crime
To use one language in each several clime
Where our scenes seems to live. I do beseech you
To learn of me, who stand i’ th’ gaps to teach you,
The stages of our story. Pericles
Is now again thwarting the wayward seas,
Attended on by many a lord and knight,
To see his daughter, all his live’s delight.
Old Helicanus goes along. Behind
Is left to govern it, you bear in mind,
Old Escanes, whom Helicanus late
Advanc’d in time to great and high estate.
Well-sailing ships and bounteous winds have brought
This king to Tharsus—think his pilot thought,
So with his steerage shall your thoughts grow on—
To fetch his daughter home, who first is gone.
Like motes and shadows see them move a while,
Your ears unto your eyes I’ll reconcile.

stagedir.dir: Enter Pericles at one door with all his Train; Cleon and Dionyza at the other. Cleon shows Pericles the tomb; whereat Pericles makes lamentation, puts on sackcloth, and in a mighty passion departs. Then exeunt Cleon and Dionyza.

speech.line: See how belief may suffer by foul show!
This borrowed passion stands for true old woe;
And Pericles, in sorrow all devour’d,
With sighs shot through and biggest tears o’ershow’r’d,
Leaves Tharsus and again embarks. He swears
Never to wash his face, nor cut his hairs;
He puts on sackcloth, and to sea. He bears
A tempest, which his mortal vessel tears,
And yet he rides it out. Now please you wit
The epitaph is for Marina writ
By wicked Dionyza.

stagedir.dir: Reads the inscription on Marina’s monument.

line.recite: “The fairest, sweetest, and best lies here,
Who withered in her spring of year.
She was of Tyrus the King’s daughter,
On whom foul death hath made this slaughter.
Marina was she call’d, and at her birth,
Thetis, being proud, swallowed some part a’ th’ earth.
Therefore the earth, fearing to be o’erflowed,
Hath Thetis’ birth-child on the heavens bestowed;
Wherefore she does, and swears she’ll never stint,
Make raging battery upon shores of flint.”

speech.line: No visor does become black villainy
So well as soft and tender flattery.
Let Pericles believe his daughter’s dead,
And bear his courses to be ordered
By Lady Fortune, while our scene must play
His daughter’s woe and heavy well-a-day
In her unholy service. Patience then,
And think you now are all in Metelin.

scene.scenelocation: Mytilene. A street before the brothel.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT. MYT.
speech.line: Did you ever hear the like?

speech.speaker: 2. GENT. MYT.
speech.line: No, nor never shall do in such a place as this, she being once gone.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT. MYT.
speech.line: But to have divinity preach’d there! Did you ever dream of such a thing?

speech.speaker: 2. GENT. MYT.
speech.line: No, no. Come, I am for no more bawdy-houses. Shall ’s go hear the vestals sing?

speech.speaker: 1. GENT. MYT.
speech.line: I’ll do any thing now that is virtuous, but I am out of the road of rutting forever.

scene.scenelocation: Mytilene. A room in the brothel.

stagedir.dir: Enter three bawds: Pander, Bawd, and Boult.

speech.speaker: PAND.
speech.line: Well, I had rather than twice the worth of her she had ne’er come here.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Fie, fie upon her, she’s able to freeze the god Priapus, and undo a whole generation. We must either get her ravish’d or be rid of her. When she should do for clients her fitment, and do me the kindness of our profession, she has me her quirks, her reasons, her master reasons, her prayers, her knees, that she would make a puritan of the devil, if he should cheapen a kiss of her.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Faith, I must ravish her, or she’ll disfurnish us of all our cavalleria, and make our swearers priests.

speech.speaker: PAND.
speech.line: Now the pox upon her green-sickness for me!

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Faith, there’s no way to be rid on’t but by the way to the pox. Here comes the Lord Lysimachus disguis’d.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: We should have both lord and lown, if the peevish baggage would but give way to customers.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: How now? How a dozen of virginities?

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Now the gods to bless your honor!

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: I am glad to see your honor in good health.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: You may so, ’tis the better for you that your resorters stand upon sound legs. How now? Wholesome iniquity have you, that a man may deal withal and defy the surgeon?

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: We have here one, sir, if she would—but there never came her like in Mytilene.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: If she’d do the deeds of darkness, thou wouldst say.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Your honor knows what ’tis to say well enough.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Well, call forth, call forth.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: For flesh and blood, sir, white and red, you shall see a rose, and she were a rose indeed, if she had but—

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: What, prithee?

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: O, sir, I can be modest.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: That dignifies the renown of a bawd, no less than it gives a good report to a number to be chaste.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Here comes that which grows to the stalk, never pluck’d yet, I can assure you.
Is she not a fair creature?

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Faith, she would serve after a long voyage at sea. Well, there’s for you, leave us.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: I beseech your honor give me leave a word, and I’ll have done presently.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: I beseech you do.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: First, I would have you note, this is an honorable man.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: I desire to find him so, that I may worthily note him.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Next, he’s the governor of this country, and a man whom I am bound to.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: If he govern the country, you are bound to him indeed, but how honorable he is in that, I know not.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Pray you, without any more virginal fencing, will you use him kindly? He will line your apron with gold.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: What he will do graciously, I will thankfully receive.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Ha’ you done?

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: My lord, she’s not pac’d yet, you must take some pains to work her to your manage. Come, we will leave his honor and her together. Go thy ways.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Now, pretty one, how long have you been at this trade?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: What trade, sir?

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Why, I cannot name ’t but I shall offend.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: I cannot be offended with my trade. Please you to name it.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: How long have you been of this profession?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: E’er since I can remember.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Did you go to’t so young? Were you a gamester at five, or at seven?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Earlier too, sir, if now I be one.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Why, the house you dwell in proclaims you to be a creature of sale.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Do you know this house to be a place of such resort, and will come into’t? I hear say you’re of honorable parts, and are the governor of this place.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Why, hath your principal made known unto you who I am?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Who is my principal?

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Why, your herb-woman, she that sets seeds and roots of shame and iniquity. O, you have heard something of my power, and so stand aloof for more serious wooing. But I protest to thee, pretty one, my authority shall not see thee, or else look friendly upon thee. Come bring me to some private place. Come, come.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: If you were born to honor, show it now;
If put upon you, make the judgment good
That thought you worthy of it.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: How’s this? How’s this? Some more, be sage.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: For me,
That am a maid, though most ungentle fortune
Have plac’d me in this sty, where since I came,
Diseases have been sold dearer than physic—
That the gods
Would set me free from this unhallowed place,
Though they did change me to the meanest bird
That flies i’ th’ purer air!

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: I did not think
Thou couldst have spoke so well, ne’er dreamt thou couldst.
Had I brought hither a corrupted mind,
Thy speech had altered it. Hold, here’s gold for thee.
Persever in that clear way thou goest,
And the gods strengthen thee!

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: The good gods preserve you!

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: For me, be you thoughten
That I came with no ill intent, for to me
The very doors and windows savor vilely.
Fare thee well, thou art a piece of virtue, and
I doubt not but thy training hath been noble.
Hold, here’s more gold for thee.
A curse upon him, die he like a thief,
That robs thee of thy goodness! If thou dost
Hear from me, it shall be for thy good.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: I beseech your honor one piece for me.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Avaunt, thou damned door-keeper!
Your house, but for this virgin that doth prop it,
Would sink and overwhelm you. Away!

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: How’s this? We must take another course with you! If your peevish chastity, which is not worth a breakfast in the cheapest country under the cope, shall undo a whole household, let me be gelded like a spaniel. Come your ways.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Whither would you have me?

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: I must have your maidenhead taken off, or the common hangman shall execute it. Come your ways. We’ll have no more gentlemen driven away. Come your ways, I say.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: How now, what’s the matter?

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Worse and worse, mistress, she has here spoken holy words to the Lord Lysimachus.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: O abominable!

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: She makes our profession as it were to stink afore the face of the gods.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Marry, hang her up forever!

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: The nobleman would have dealt with her like a nobleman, and she sent him away as cold as a snowball, saying his prayers too.

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: Boult, take her away, use her at thy pleasure. Crack the glass of her virginity, and make the rest malleable.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: And if she were a thornier piece of ground than she is, she shall be plough’d.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Hark, hark, you gods!

speech.speaker: BAWD.
speech.line: She conjures, away with her! Would she had never come within my doors. Marry, hang you! She’s born to undo us. Will you not go the way of womenkind? Marry, come up, my dish of chastity with rosemary and bays!

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Come, mistress, come your ways with me.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Whither wilt thou have me?

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: To take from you the jewel you hold so dear.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Prithee tell me one thing first.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Come now, your one thing.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: What canst thou wish thine enemy to be?

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Why, I could wish him to be my master, or rather, my mistress.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Neither of these are so bad as thou art,
Since they do better thee in their command.
Thou hold’st a place for which the pained’st fiend
Of hell would not in reputation change.
Thou art the damned door-keeper to every
Custrel that comes inquiring for his Tib.
To the choleric fisting of every rogue
Thy ear is liable; thy food is such
As hath been belch’d on by infected lungs.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: What would you have me do? Go to the wars, would you? Where a man may serve seven years for the loss of a leg, and have not money enough in the end to buy him a wooden one?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Do any thing but this thou doest. Empty
Old receptacles, or common shores, of filth,
Serve by indenture to the common hangman:
Any of these ways are yet better than this;
For what thou professest, a baboon, could he speak,
Would own a name too dear. That the gods
Would safely deliver me from this place!
Here, here’s gold for thee.
If that thy master would gain by me,
Proclaim that I can sing, weave, sew, and dance,
With other virtues, which I’ll keep from boast,
And will undertake all these to teach.
I doubt not but this populous city will
Yield many scholars.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: But can you teach all this you speak of?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Prove that I cannot, take me home again
And prostitute me to the basest groom
That doth frequent your house.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Well, I will see what I can do for thee. If I can place thee, I will.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: But amongst honest women.

speech.speaker: BOULT.
speech.line: Faith, my acquaintance lies little amongst them. But since my master and mistress hath bought you, there’s no going but by their consent. Therefore I will make them acquainted with your purpose, and I doubt not but I shall find them tractable enough. Come, I’ll do for thee what I can; come your ways.

speech.speaker: GOW.
speech.line: Marina thus the brothel scapes, and chances
Into an honest house, our story says.
She sings like one immortal, and she dances
As goddess-like to her admired lays.
Deep clerks she dumbs, and with her neele composes
Nature’s own shape of bud, bird, branch, or berry,
That even her art sisters the natural roses;
Her inkle, silk, twin with the rubied cherry,
That pupils lacks she none of noble race,
Who pour their bounty on her; and her gain
She gives the cursed bawd. Here we her place,
And to her father turn our thoughts again,
Where we left him, on the sea. We there him lost,
Where, driven before the winds, he is arriv’d
Here where his daughter dwells, and on this coast
Suppose him now at anchor. The city striv’d
God Neptune’s annual feast to keep, from whence
Lysimachus our Tyrian ship espies,
His banners sable, trimm’d with rich expense,
And to him in his barge with fervor hies.
In your supposing once more put your sight:
Of heavy Pericles think this his bark;
Where what is done in action, more, if might,
Shall be discover’d, please you sit and hark.

scene.scenelocation: On board Pericles’s ship, off Mytilene.

stagedir.dir: On board Pericles’ ship, off Mytilene. A close pavilion on deck, with a curtain before it; Pericles within it, reclined on a couch.
Enter Helicanus; to him two Sailors, one of Tyre, the other of Mytilene.

speech.speaker: TYR. SAIL.
speech.line: Where is Lord Helicanus? He can resolve you.
O, here he is.—
Sir, there is a barge put off from Mytilene,
And in it is Lysimachus the governor,
Who craves to come aboard. What is your will?

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: That he have his. Call up some gentlemen.

speech.speaker: TYR. SAIL.
speech.line: Ho, gentlemen! My lord calls.

speech.speaker: 1. GENT. TYRE.
speech.line: Doth your lordship call?

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: Gentlemen, there is some of worth would come aboard;
I pray greet him fairly.

stagedir.dir: Exeunt Gentlemen, Sailor of Tyre and Sailor of Mytilene.
Enter Lysimachus and Lords with the Gentlemen and the Tyrian Sailor.

speech.speaker: TYR. SAIL.
speech.line: Sir,
This is the man that can, in aught you would,
Resolve you.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Hail, reverent sir! The gods preserve you!

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: And you, to outlive the age I am,
And die as I would do.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: You wish me well.
Being on shore, honoring of Neptune’s triumphs,
Seeing this goodly vessel ride before us,
I made to it to know of whence you are.

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: First, what is your place?

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: I am the governor of this place you lie before.

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: Sir,
Our vessel is of Tyre, in it the King,
A man who for this three months hath not spoken
To any one, nor taken sustenance
But to prorogue his grief.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Upon what ground is his distemperature?

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: ’Twould be too tedious to repeat,
But the main grief springs from the loss
Of a beloved daughter and a wife.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: May we not see him?

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: You may,
But bootless is your sight; he will not speak
To any.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Yet let me obtain my wish.

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: Behold him.
This was a goodly person,
Till the disaster that, one mortal night,
Drove him to this.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Sir King, all hail! The gods preserve you! Hail, royal sir!

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: It is in vain, he will not speak to you.

speech.speaker: LORD. MYT.
speech.line: Sir,
We have a maid in Mytilene, I durst wager,
Would win some words of him.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: ’Tis well bethought.
She questionless with her sweet harmony,
And other chosen attractions, would allure
And make a batt’ry through his deafen’d parts,
Which now are midway stopp’d.
She is all happy as the fairest of all,
And with her fellow maids, is now upon
The leavy shelter that abuts against
The island’s side.

stagedir.dir: Gives an order to a Lord, who goes out.

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: Sure all effectless; yet nothing we’ll omit
That bears recovery’s name. But since your kindness
We have stretch’d thus far, let us beseech you
That for our gold we may provision have,
Wherein we are not destitute for want,
But weary for the staleness.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: O sir, a courtesy
Which if we should deny, the most just God
For every graff would send a caterpillar,
And so inflict our province. Yet once more
Let me entreat to know at large the cause
Of your king’s sorrow.

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: Sit, sir, I will recount it to you,
But see, I am prevented.

stagedir.dir: Enter Lord with Marina and a young Lady.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: O, here’s
The lady that I sent for. Welcome, fair one!
—Is’t not a goodly presence?

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: She’s a gallant lady.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: She’s such a one that were I well assur’d
Came of a gentle kind and noble stock,
I’d wish no better choice, and think me rarely to wed.
Fair one, all goodness that consists in beauty,
Expect even here, where is a kingly patient,
If that thy prosperous and artificial feat
Can draw him but to answer thee in aught,
Thy sacred physic shall receive such pay
As thy desires can wish.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Sir, I will use
My utmost skill in his recovery, provided
That none but I and my companion maid
Be suffered to come near him.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Come, let us leave her,
And the gods make her prosperous!

stagedir.dir: They withdraw. Marina sings the song.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Mark’d he your music?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: No, nor look’d on us.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: See, she will speak to him.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Hail, sir! My lord, lend ear.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Hum, ha!

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: I am a maid,
My lord, that ne’er before invited eyes,
But have been gaz’d on like a comet. She speaks,
My lord, that, may be, hath endur’d a grief
Might equal yours, if both were justly weigh’d.
Though wayward fortune did malign my state,
My derivation was from ancestors
Who stood equivalent with mighty kings,
But time hath rooted out my parentage,
And to the world and awkward casualties
Bound me in servitude.
I will desist,
But there is something glows upon my cheek,
And whispers in mine ear, “Go not till he speak.”

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: My fortunes—parentage—good parentage—
To equal mine—was it not thus? What say you?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: I said, my lord, if you did know my parentage,
You would not do me violence.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: I do think so. Pray you turn your eyes upon me.
You’re like something that—What country-woman?
Here of these shores?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: No, nor of any shores,
Yet I was mortally brought forth, and am
No other than I appear.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: I am great with woe, and shall deliver weeping.
My dearest wife was like this maid, and such a one
My daughter might have been. My queen’s square brows,
Her stature to an inch, as wand-like straight,
As silver-voic’d, her eyes as jewel-like
And cas’d as richly, in pace another Juno;
Who starves the ears she feeds, and makes them hungry,
The more she gives them speech. Where do you live?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Where I am but a stranger. From the deck
You may discern the place.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Where were you bred?
And how achiev’d you these endowments which
You make more rich to owe?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: If I should tell my history, it would seem
Like lies disdain’d in the reporting.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Prithee speak.
Falseness cannot come from thee, for thou lookest
Modest as Justice, and thou seemest a palace
For the crown’d Truth to dwell in. I will believe thee,
And make my senses credit thy relation
To points that seem impossible, for thou lookest
Like one I lov’d indeed. What were thy friends?
Didst thou not say, when I did push thee back—
Which was when I perceiv’d thee—that thou cam’st
From good descending?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: So indeed I did.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Report thy parentage. I think thou saidst
Thou hadst been toss’d from wrong to injury,
And that thou thoughts’ thy griefs might equal mine,
If both were opened.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Some such thing
I said, and said no more but what my thoughts
Did warrant me was likely.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Tell thy story;
If thine, considered, prove the thousand part
Of my endurance, thou art a man, and I
Have suffered like a girl. Yet thou dost look
Like Patience gazing on kings’ graves, and smiling
Extremity out of act. What were thy friends?
How lost thou them? Thy name, my most kind virgin?
Recount, I do beseech thee. Come sit by me.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: My name is Marina.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: O, I am mock’d,
And thou by some incensed god sent hither
To make the world to laugh at me.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Patience, good sir!
Or here I’ll cease.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Nay, I’ll be patient.
Thou little know’st how thou dost startle me
To call thyself Marina.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: The name
Was given me by one that had some power,
My father, and a king.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: How, a king’s daughter?
And call’d Marina?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: You said you would believe me,
But not to be a troubler of your peace,
I will end here.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: But are you flesh and blood?
Have you a working pulse, and are no fairy?
Motion? Well, speak on. Where were you born?
And wherefore call’d Marina?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Call’d Marina
For I was born at sea.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: At sea! What mother?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: My mother was the daughter of a king,
Who died the minute I was born,
As my good nurse Lychorida hath oft
Delivered weeping.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: O, stop there a little!
This is the rarest dream that e’er dull’d sleep
Did mock sad fools withal. This cannot be
My daughter—buried!—Well, where were you bred?
I’ll hear you more, to th’ bottom of your story,
And never interrupt you.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: You scorn. Believe me, ’twere best I did give o’er.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: I will believe you by the syllable
Of what you shall deliver. Yet give me leave:
How came you in these parts? Where were you bred?

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: The King my father did in Tharsus leave me,
Till cruel Cleon, with his wicked wife,
Did seek to murder me; and having wooed
A villain to attempt it, who having drawn to do’t,
A crew of pirates came and rescued me;
Brought me to Mytilene. But, good sir,
Whither will you have me? Why do you weep? It may be
You think me an imposture. No, good faith;
I am the daughter to King Pericles,
If good King Pericles be.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Ho, Helicanus!

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: Calls my lord?

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Thou art a grave and noble counsellor,
Most wise in general, tell me if thou canst,
What this maid is, or what is like to be,
That thus hath made me weep.

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: I know not, but
Here’s the regent, sir, of Mytilene
Speaks nobly of her.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: She never would tell
Her parentage; being demanded that,
She would sit still and weep.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: O Helicanus, strike me, honored sir,
Give me a gash, put me to present pain,
Lest this great sea of joys rushing upon me
O’erbear the shores of my mortality,
And drown me with their sweetness. O, come hither,
Thou that beget’st him that did thee beget;
Thou that wast born at sea, buried at Tharsus,
And found at sea again! O Helicanus,
Down on thy knees, thank the holy gods as loud
As thunder threatens us. This is Marina.
What was thy mother’s name? Tell me but that,
For truth can never be confirm’d enough,
Though doubts did ever sleep.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: First, sir, I pray,
What is your title?

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: I am Pericles of Tyre; but tell me now
My drown’d queen’s name, as in the rest you said
Thou hast been godlike perfit,
The heir of kingdoms, and another life
To Pericles thy father.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: Is it no more to be your daughter than
To say my mother’s name was Thaisa?
Thaisa was my mother, who did end
The minute I began.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Now blessing on thee! Rise, th’ art my child.
Give me fresh garments. Mine own Helicanus,
She is not dead at Tharsus as she should have been
By savage Cleon. She shall tell thee all,
When thou shalt kneel, and justify in knowledge
She is thy very princess. Who is this?

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: Sir, ’tis the governor of Mytilene,
Who, hearing of your melancholy state,
Did come to see you.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: I embrace you.
Give me my robes. I am wild in my beholding.
O heavens bless my girl! But hark, what music?
Tell Helicanus, my Marina, tell him
O’er, point by point, for yet he seems to dote,
How sure you are my daughter. But what music?

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: My lord, I hear none.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: None?
The music of the spheres! List, my Marina.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: It is not good to cross him, give him way.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Rarest sounds! Do ye not hear?

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Music, my lord? I hear.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Most heavenly music!
It nips me unto list’ning, and thick slumber
Hangs upon mine eyes. Let me rest.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: A pillow for his head.
So leave him all. Well, my companion friends,
If this but answer to my just belief,
I’ll well remember you.

stagedir.dir: Diana appears to Pericles as in a vision.

speech.speaker: DIA.
speech.line: My temple stands in Ephesus, hie thee thither,
And do upon mine altar sacrifice.
There, when my maiden priests are met together
Before the people all,
Reveal how thou at sea didst lose thy wife.
To mourn thy crosses, with thy daughter’s, call
And give them repetition to the life.
Or perform my bidding, or thou livest in woe;
Do’t, and happy, by my silver bow!
Awake, and tell thy dream.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Celestial Dian, goddess argentine,
I will obey thee. Helicanus!

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: Sir?

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: My purpose was for Tharsus, there to strike
The inhospitable Cleon, but I am
For other service first. Toward Ephesus
Turn our blown sails; eftsoons I’ll tell thee why.
Shall we refresh us, sir, upon your shore,
And give you gold for such provision
As our intents will need?

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Sir,
With all my heart, and, when you come ashore,
I have another suit.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: You shall prevail,
Were it to woo my daughter, for it seems
You have been noble towards her.

speech.speaker: LYS.
speech.line: Sir, lend me your arm.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Come, my Marina.

scene.scenelocation: Ephesus. Before the temple of Diana.

speech.speaker: GOW.
speech.line: Now our sands are almost run,
More a little, and then dumb.
This, my last boon, give me,
For such kindness must relieve me:
That you aptly will suppose
What pageantry, what feats, what shows,
What minstrelsy, and pretty din,
The regent made in Metelin,
To greet the King. So he thrived
That he is promis’d to be wived
To fair Marina, but in no wise
Till he had done his sacrifice,
As Dian bade; whereto being bound,
The interim, pray you, all confound.
In feather’d briefness sails are fill’d,
And wishes fall out as they’re will’d.
At Ephesus the temple see,
Our King and all his company.
That he can hither come so soon
Is by your fancies’ thankful doom.

scene.scenelocation: The temple of Diana at Ephesus.

stagedir.dir: The Temple of Diana at Ephesus; Thaisa standing near the altar, as high priestess; a number of Virgins on each side; Cerimon and other inhabitants of Ephesus attending.
Enter Pericles with his Train: Lysimachus, Helicanus, Marina, and a Lady.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Hail, Dian! To perform thy just command,
I here confess myself the King of Tyre,
Who frighted from my country, did wed
At Pentapolis the fair Thaisa.
At sea in child-bed died she, but brought forth
A maid-child call’d Marina, whom, O goddess,
Wears yet thy silver livery. She at Tharsus
Was nurs’d with Cleon, who at fourteen years
He sought to murder, but her better stars
Brought her to Mytilene, ’gainst whose shore
Riding, her fortunes brought the maid aboard us,
Where, by her own most clear remembrance, she
Made known herself my daughter.

speech.speaker: THAI.
speech.line: Voice and favor!
You are, you are—O royal Pericles!

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: What means the nun? She dies, help, gentlemen!

speech.speaker: CER.
speech.line: Noble sir,
If you have told Diana’s altar true,
This is your wife.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Reverent appearer, no,
I threw her overboard with these very arms.

speech.speaker: CER.
speech.line: Upon this coast, I warrant you.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: ’Tis most certain.

speech.speaker: CER.
speech.line: Look to the lady; O, she’s but overjoy’d.
Early in blustering morn this lady was
Thrown upon this shore. I op’d the coffin,
Found there rich jewels, recovered her, and plac’d her
Here in Diana’s temple.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: May we see them?

speech.speaker: CER.
speech.line: Great sir, they shall be brought you to my house,
Whither I invite you. Look, Thaisa is
Recovered.

speech.speaker: THAI.
speech.line: O, let me look!
If he be none of mine, my sanctity
Will to my sense bend no licentious ear,
But curb it, spite of seeing. O my lord,
Are you not Pericles? Like him you spake,
Like him you are! Did you not name a tempest,
A birth, and death?

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: The voice of dead Thaisa!

speech.speaker: THAI.
speech.line: That Thaisa am I, supposed dead
And drown’d.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Immortal Dian!

speech.speaker: THAI.
speech.line: Now I know you better.
When we with tears parted Pentapolis,
The King my father gave you such a ring.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: This, this. No more, you gods! Your present kindness
Makes my past miseries sports. You shall do well
That on the touching of her lips I may
Melt, and no more be seen. O, come, be buried
A second time within these arms.

speech.speaker: MAR.
speech.line: My heart
Leaps to be gone into my mother’s bosom.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Look who kneels here! Flesh of thy flesh, Thaisa,
Thy burden at the sea, and call’d Marina
For she was yielded there.

speech.speaker: THAI.
speech.line: Blest, and mine own!

speech.speaker: HEL.
speech.line: Hail, madam, and my queen!

speech.speaker: THAI.
speech.line: I know you not.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: You have heard me say, when I did fly from Tyre,
I left behind an ancient substitute.
Can you remember what I call’d the man?
I have nam’d him oft.

speech.speaker: THAI.
speech.line: ’Twas Helicanus then.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Still confirmation!
Embrace him, dear Thaisa, this is he.
Now do I long to hear how you were found,
How possibly preserved, and who to thank
(Besides the gods) for this great miracle.

speech.speaker: THAI.
speech.line: Lord Cerimon, my lord; this man,
Through whom the gods have shown their power; that can
From first to last resolve you.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Reverent sir,
The gods can have no mortal officer
More like a god than you. Will you deliver
How this dead queen relives?

speech.speaker: CER.
speech.line: I will, my lord.
Beseech you first, go with me to my house,
Where shall be shown you all was found with her;
How she came plac’d here in the temple;
No needful thing omitted.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Pure Dian,
I bless thee for thy vision, and will offer
Night-oblations to thee. Thaisa,
This prince, the fair-betrothed of your daughter,
Shall marry her at Pentapolis. And now
This ornament
Makes me look dismal will I clip to form,
And what this fourteen years no razor touch’d,
To grace thy marriage-day, I’ll beautify.

speech.speaker: THAI.
speech.line: Lord Cerimon hath letters of good credit, sir,
My father’s dead.

speech.speaker: PER.
speech.line: Heavens make a star of him! Yet there, my queen,
We’ll celebrate their nuptials, and ourselves
Will in that kingdom spend our following days.
Our son and daughter shall in Tyrus reign.
Lord Cerimon, we do our longing stay
To hear the rest untold. Sir, lead ’s the way.

speech.speaker: GOW.
speech.line: In Antiochus and his daughter you have heard
Of monstrous lust the due and just reward.
In Pericles, his queen and daughter, seen,
Although assail’d with fortune fierce and keen,
Virtue preserv’d from fell destruction’s blast,
Led on by heaven, and crown’d with joy at last.
In Helicanus may you well descry
A figure of truth, of faith, of loyalty.
In reverend Cerimon there well appears
The worth that learned charity aye wears.
For wicked Cleon and his wife, when fame
Had spread his cursed deed, the honor’d name
Of Pericles to rage the city turn,
That him and his they in his palace burn;
The gods for murder seemed so content
To punish, although not done, but meant.
So, on your patience evermore attending,
New joy wait on you! Here our play has ending.
